version_description:
We've made it easier and FASTER and BETTER QUALITY to import videos from your Photos app into Vee! Sorry to shout but we're excited! You can now import MULTIPLE CLIPS, and there are larger previews so you can see what you're getting. As an added bonus, you can IMPORT PHOTOS now too. You can adjust the duration of a photo clip, and you even apply filters.

What was that?
• Import multiple clips from your Photos app, faster and without recompressing (better quality)
• Import still photos

If you're on a 6s or 6s Plus, use the FORCE (touch, that is) to get previews of photos and videos before you import them. If your midi-chlorian stocks are low you can just long press; we got your back!

Also we've fixed a few bugs and made some other little improvements, such as:
• Front-facing camera works again (whoops, we are not shooting enough selfies at Vee HQ)
• iPad Pro now works real good

Keep in touch on Twitter @veeforvideo! We love to see videos you've shot with Vee. If you have a moment for a nice review, we'd really appreciate it. We release often to keep getting great new features and improvements to you, but each time we release we have to start again with our reviews *sob*. If you like Vee, tell everyone how much you like it. We really appreciate it!

Vee 1.7 adds audio control per clip, so you can adjust the balance between soundtrack and clip audio on EACH CLIP. What's more we have improved the soundtrack importing; now you can import from 3rd party software such as AudioCopy and AudioShare, and you can seamlessly loop soundtracks.

We've also added a Transform control, so you can rotate and flip each clip. Shot your video upside down like an ANIMAL?! You can now fix that right up in Vee 1.7.

In other news:
• We fixed the Dropbox sharing bug
• Some pixels were realigned
• Projects that mix different video resolutions make better choices about the export resolution (no longer chooses the lowest quality)

You may notice:
• When you're editing a clip, the sound is no longer muted by default! You can still mute it using the little mute button in the top-right, but it's no longer muted by default.

Keep in touch on Twitter @veeforvideo! We love to see videos you've shot with Vee. If you have a moment for a nice review, we'd really appreciate it. We release often to keep getting great new features and improvements to you, but each time we release we have to start again with our reviews *sob*. If you like Vee, tell everyone how much you like it. We really appreciate it!


Previously on Vee 1.6:

• Import multiple clips from your Photos app, faster and without recompressing (better quality)
• Import still photos
• Force touch
• iPad Pro support
• Bug fixes

Vee 1.7 adds audio control per clip, so you can adjust the balance between soundtrack and clip audio on EACH CLIP. What's more we have improved the soundtrack importing; now you can import from 3rd party software such as AudioCopy and AudioShare, and you can seamlessly loop soundtracks.

We've also added a Transform control, so you can rotate and flip each clip. Shot your video upside down like an ANIMAL?! You can now fix that right up in Vee 1.7.

In other news:
• We fixed the Dropbox sharing bug
• Some pixels were realigned
• Projects that mix different video resolutions make better choices about the export resolution (no longer chooses the lowest quality)

You may notice:
• When you're editing a clip, the sound is no longer muted by default! You can still mute it using the little mute button in the top-right, but it's no longer muted by default.

Keep in touch on Twitter @veeforvideo! We love to see videos you've shot with Vee. If you have a moment for a nice review, we'd really appreciate it. We release often to keep getting great new features and improvements to you, but each time we release we have to start again with our reviews *sob*. If you like Vee, tell everyone how much you like it. We really appreciate it!

Update and take a look. Do you notice anything different? We’ll wait, it’s Cool… That’s right! One word: San Francisco. We’ve gone all cosmopolitan and kicked dowdy old DIN to the curb. Check out those vertically centered colons! Maybe you also noticed the fancy new icon? Icons with large Vs on them are so last-week. Welcome to the new era of Vee! And it’s not just about the looks (although we’ll always accept a compliment) — while we were there we’ve made everything a tad bigger; bigger timeline, bigger buttons, bigger type; bigger and better and easier to use.

In other news, we’ve been fixing bugs and putting Vee through its paces making sure it’s as stable as can be for you! If you find any more faults, please get in touch via our website veeforvideo.com.

And if you’ve read this far, why not proceed without delay to lay a five-star review on us and help others discover how much they need Vee in their lives?

Keep in touch on Twitter @veeforvideo! Love you all!
Vee Team

In Vee 1.9 we've got some great updates for Pro video shooting. We've always supported separate focus + exposure points (by using a second finger). We now add the ability to gesture up & down to adjust exposure—just like the stock camera app. In Vee you can now also drag left + right to adjust focus!

This release includes various bug fixes and performance improvements.

We'd love to see your videos, share with us using #veeforvideo

This release includes various bug fixes and performance improvements.

We'd love to see your videos, share with us using #veeforvideo

This app has been updated by Apple to use the latest Apple signing certificate.

Vee 1.10 adds Precise Trimming capability. When you're trimming, simply keep your finger on the screen, drag it up away from the timeline, and scrub left and right as per usual. The higher you drag your finger up, the more precise the trimming. When your finger is near the top of the screen you'll be trimming one frame of video at a time. Now that's precise trimming! To help you see what you're doing, we've added a frame counter to the time stamp display at the top of the screen.

Vee 1.10 also gives you the capability to share your video with a frame rate other than 30 FPS. We've also added a sharing quality step to every sharing method, so you can always choose the resolution and frame rate for each video you share, and we remember what you chose for each sharing method so Vee learns what you like.

This app has been updated by Apple to use the latest Apple signing certificate.
